question.text: What is correct about the heart of cockroach?

options.text: Blood flows towards the posterior end of the body in the heart.
The heart appears as an elongated tubular structure.
Multi-chambered with ostia as the opening between the two chambers.

solution.text:
A cockroach possesses a 13-chambered tubular, muscular, elongated and neurogenic heart.
Blood circulation in cockroach is maintained by wing-shaped alary muscles (involuntary).
Each chamber of the heart receives blood from the sinus through 1 pair of slit-like openings called ostia.

The flow of blood can be represented as:

Blood in heart → Pumped into the sinuses → Re-enter the heart by ostia → Again pumped into the sinuses.
